title: Beginner's Adventure Taster
tagline: Your first taste of Welsh adventure
suitableFor: Active beginners and couples looking for a mix of gentle adventure and scenic beauty. Those with a reasonable level of fitness who enjoy being outdoors.
notSuitableFor: Those seeking extreme adrenaline rushes, or those with limited mobility. This trip is not ideal for families with very young children.

stops.title: Llanberis Path Gentle Hike
stops.description: Enjoy a relaxed walk along the lower sections of the Llanberis Path, offering stunning views of Snowdon and Llyn Peris. This avoids the steep sections and crowds higher up.

wetAlt.title: National Slate Museum
wetAlt.description: Explore the history of the Welsh slate industry in this fascinating indoor museum, located near Llanberis.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic by Llyn Peris
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the views of the lake from the shores.

stops.title: Pete's Eats
stops.description: A legendary cafe in Llanberis, famous for its hearty portions and climber-friendly atmosphere.
stops.travelToNext: 45 min drive via A4086 and A5

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Ogwen
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own lunch with a view.

stops.title: Zip World Fforest Coaster
stops.description: Experience a thrilling toboggan ride through the forest at Zip World Fforest. Control your own speed as you navigate the twists and turns.
stops.travelToNext: 20 min drive via A5 and A470

wetAlt.title: Tree Top Nets
wetAlt.description: Bounce around in giant nets suspended high in the trees at Zip World Fforest.

budgetAlt.title: Walking trails in Gwydir Forest
budgetAlt.description: Explore the scenic walking trails around Betws-y-Coed.

stops.title: Plas y Brenin
stops.description: A well-regarded activity centre and hotel near Capel Curig, offering comfortable rooms and a relaxed atmosphere. Great for outdoor enthusiasts.

budgetAlt.title: YHA Snowdon Pen-y-Pass
budgetAlt.description: A budget-friendly hostel in a stunning location, perfect for hikers and outdoor adventurers.

stops.title: Gorge Walking Intro
stops.description: Experience the thrill of gorge walking with Adventure Britain near Bala. Scramble up waterfalls, swim in plunge pools, and enjoy the natural beauty of the Welsh countryside.

wetAlt.title: Bounce Below
wetAlt.description: Trampoline in a disused mine. An interesting and unique adventure.

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Lake Bala
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the view while walking around the lake

stops.title: Riverside Cafe Bala
stops.description: Cosy cafe beside the River Dee

budgetAlt.title: Packed Lunch
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a cheap lunch by the river

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Snowdonia weather can be unpredictable, even in summer. Be prepared for rain, wind, and sunshine, often all in the same day.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy during peak season, especially on the A5 and A4086. Allow extra time for travel, particularly on weekends and bank holidays. Parking in popular areas like Llanberis and Pen-y-Pass can be challenging; arrive early or use park-and-ride services.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for Zip World activities, especially during school holidays. Gorge walking tours also require pre-booking.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary is designed for beginners but still requires a reasonable level of fitness. The Llanberis Path walk is gentle, but some walking on uneven terrain is involved. Gorge walking requires some scrambling and swimming.
